channel.title: CVE Feed for Dell -- CPG BIOS
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Dell -- CPG BIOS

item.title: CVE-2022-26863|2024-09-16T20:48:18.563Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Prior Dell BIOS versions contain an Input Validation vulnerability. A locally authenticated malicious user could potentially exploit this vulnerability by sending malicious input to an SMI in order to bypass security controls in SMM.

item.title: CVE-2022-32486|2024-09-16T20:16:41.271Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability by using an SMI to gain arbitrary code execution in SMRAM.

item.title: CVE-2022-24419|2024-09-16T17:15:25.517Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability by using an SMI to gain arbitrary code execution during SMM.

item.title: CVE-2022-32484|2024-09-16T18:54:06.704Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user with admin privileges may potentially exploit this vulnerability in order to modify a UEFI variable.

item.title: CVE-2022-22567|2024-09-16T20:51:53.564Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Select Dell Client Commercial and Consumer platforms are vulnerable to an insufficient verification of data authenticity vulnerability. An authenticated malicious user may exploit this vulnerability in order to install modified BIOS firmware.

item.title: CVE-2020-5379|2024-09-16T19:30:42.663Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell Inspiron 7352 BIOS versions prior to A12 contain a UEFI BIOS Boot Services overwrite vulnerability. A local attacker with access to system memory may exploit this vulnerability by overwriting the EFI_BOOT_SERVICES structure to execute arbitrary code in System Management Mode (SMM).

item.title: CVE-2022-26861|2024-09-16T20:47:50.610Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS versions contain an Insecure Automated Optimization vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user could exploit this vulnerability by sending malicious input via SMI to obtain arbitrary code execution during SMM.

item.title: CVE-2021-36343|2024-09-16T16:44:04.277Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability by using an SMI to gain arbitrary code execution in SMRAM.

item.title: CVE-2022-26859|2024-09-16T20:27:09.531Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains a race condition vulnerability. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending malicious input via SMI in order to bypass security checks during SMM.

item.description: Dell BIOS contains an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability by using an SMI to gain arbitrary code execution in SMRAM.

item.description: Prior Dell BIOS versions contain an Input Validation vulnerability. A locally authenticated malicious user could potentially exploit this vulnerability by sending malicious input to an SMI in order to bypass security controls in SMM.

item.title: CVE-2022-31220|2024-09-16T16:28:32.072Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS versions contain an Unchecked Return Value vulnerability. A local authenticated administrator user could potentially exploit this vulnerability in order to change the state of the system or cause unexpected failures.

item.title: CVE-2021-36325|2024-09-16T20:31:51.469Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability by using an SMI to gain arbitrary code execution in SMRAM.

item.title: CVE-2022-34390|2024-09-16T20:26:43.640Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains a use of uninitialized variable vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability by using an SMI to gain arbitrary code execution in SMRAM.

item.title: CVE-2022-34391|2024-09-16T20:01:45.405Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell Client BIOS Versions prior to the remediated version contain an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability by using an SMI to gain arbitrary code execution in SMRAM.

item.title: CVE-2024-32859|2024-08-02T02:20:35.656Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell Client Platform BIOS contains an Improper Input Validation vulnerability in an externally developed component. A high privileged attacker with local access could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to Code execution.

item.description: Dell Client Platform BIOS contains an Improper Input Validation vulnerability in an externally developed component. A high privileged attacker with local access could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to Code execution.

item.description: Dell Client Platform BIOS contains an Out-of-bounds Write vulnerability in an externally developed component. A high privileged attacker with local access could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to Information tampering.

item.description: Dell Client Platform contains an incorrect authorization vulnerability. An attacker with physical access to the system could potentially exploit this vulnerability by bypassing BIOS authorization to modify settings in the BIOS.

item.description: Dell BIOS contains a missing support for integrity check vulnerability. An attacker with physical access to the system could potentially bypass security mechanisms to run arbitrary code on the system.
